DataElement.preferredName: Urinary Immunoglobulin Light Chain Laboratory Procedure Performed Integer::1 Decimal Place Gram per 24 Hours Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place gram per 24 hour numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of urinary monoclonal light chains in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Urinary Immunoglobulin Light Chain Laboratory Procedure Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Urinary; of or relating to urine, of or relating to the urinary system, or of or relating to the function or production or secretion of urine._A protein complex that consists of two light chains (kappa and lambda). The light chain molecules are of the same structure and composition, consisting of constant, variable, and hypervariable regions._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Urinary Immunoglobulin Light Chain Laboratory Procedure
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with urine or the organs of the body that produce and get rid of urine.:A protein complex that consists of two light chains (kappa and lambda). The light chain molecules are of the same structure and composition, consisting of constant, variable, and hypervariable regions.:Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Concepts.definition: Urinary; of or relating to urine, of or relating to the urinary system, or of or relating to the function or production or secretion of urine.

A protein complex that consists of two light chains (kappa and lambda). The light chain molecules are of the same structure and composition, consisting of constant, variable, and hypervariable regions.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure 1 Decimal Place Gram per 24 Hours Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting_A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A metric mass flow rate unit equal to the rate at which mass of matter of one gram crosses a given surface or/and is transferred over a period of twenty four hours._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Integer::1 Decimal Place Gram per 24 Hours Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A metric mass flow rate unit equal to the rate at which mass of matter of one gram crosses a given surface or/and is transferred over a period of twenty four hours.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A metric mass flow rate unit equal to the rate at which mass of matter of one gram crosses a given surface or/and is transferred over a period of twenty four hours.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
